Title: Phylogeny of Cyclanthaceae.
Abstract:
The affinities of Cyclanthaceae are discussed, and it is
concluded that the sister- group to this family is most probably
Pandanaceae. A hypothesis of generic relationships in Cyclanthaceae,
based on cladistic methods, is presented. Bootstrap analysis and Bremer
support (decay index) have been used to test the strength of individual
clades, and the result is compared with previously made phylogenetic
analyses. The Sphaeradenia group (Chorigyne, Stelestylis, Sphaeradenia,
and Ludovia) is supported as monophyletic and acceptably resolved, while
the Asplundia group (remaining genera in Carludovicoideae) may be
paraphyletic, with largely uncertain relationships. A formal recognition
of these groups is therefore not justifed. The probable character
evolution in Carludovicoideae is discussed.
